content.prompt: The function g is given by gx=2cosπx+1. Which of the following is the graph of g for 0≤x≤4 ?

choices.label:
• The x axis ranges from 0 to 4 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 1 to 3 in increments of 1.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins at (0 comma 3) and decreases to the point (1 comma negative 1).
    • Upon reaching (1 comma negative 1), the curve changes directions, increasing to (2 comma 3).
    • Upon reaching (2 comma 3), the curve changes directions, decreasing to (3 comma negative 1).
    • Upon reaching (3 comma negative 1), the curve changes directions, increasing to (4 comma 3), at which point it ends.

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option A. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
• The x axis ranges from 0 to 4 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 1 to 3 in increments of 1.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins at (0 comma 3) and decreases to the point (1 comma 1).
    • Upon reaching (1 comma 1), the curve changes directions, increasing to (2 comma 3).
    • Upon reaching (2 comma 3), the curve changes directions, decreasing to (3 comma 1).
    • Upon reaching (3 comma 1), the curve changes directions, increasing to (4 comma 3), at which point it ends.

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option B. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
• The x axis ranges from 0 to 4 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 1 to 3 in increments of 1.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins at (0 comma 3) and decreases to pass through (1 comma 1) and reach (2 comma negative 1).
    • Upon reaching (2 comma negative 1), the curve changes directions, increasing to pass through (3 comma 1) and end at (4 comma 3).

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option C. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
• The x axis ranges from 0 to 4 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 1 to 3 in increments of 1.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins at (0 comma 1) and increases to the point (0.5 comma 3).
    • Upon reaching (0.5 comma 3), the curve changes directions, decreasing through (1 comma 1) to (1.5 comma negative 1).
    • Upon reaching (1.5 comma negative 1), the curve changes directions, increasing through (2 comma 1) to (2.5 comma 3).
    • Upon reaching (2.5 comma 3), the curve changes directions, decreasing through (3 comma 1) to (3.5 comma negative 1).
    • Upon reaching (3.5 comma negative 1), the curve changes directions, increasing to (4 comma 1), at which point it ends.

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option D. Refer to its long description

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
